subject: Medicine
title: Neutrophils: First Responders
description: A quick, practical guide to Neutrophils: First Responders.

hook.text: Within minutes of a cut, millions of neutrophils swarm to the wound like firefighters to a blaze.

buildup.text: Neutrophils are the most abundant white blood cellsâ€”your immune system's rapid response team.

discovery.text: They engulf and digest bacteria, then die. The pus in a wound is a graveyard of spent neutrophils.

twist.text: Neutrophils live only 5 days. Your body produces 100 billion new ones daily to replace them.

climax.text: They're disposable soldiersâ€”cheap, fast, and expendable. Quantity wins the first battle.

punchline.text: Pus means your army fought and won.

quiz.question: What is pus made of?
options: Dead neutrophils that fought off bacteria
Excess bacteria that survived the immune response
Damaged skin cells from the wound
